revised_title: Chemical Composition of the Humours of the Eye
tldr: Richard Chenevix investigates the chemical composition of the humours in the eye, including the aqueous, crystalline, and vitreous humours. He finds that they are composed of water, albumen, gelatine, and a muriate of soda, with slight variations in specific gravity between different types of eyes. Chenevix also suggests that the density of the crystalline lens may play a role in the development of cataracts.
